alert.note: Alert for Park (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 10:19AM MDT until June 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Unprecedented flooding occurring on the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs affecting Park County. .Heavy rain falling on the snowpack over the southern Beartooth/Absaroka mountains has resulted in unprecedented rises on the Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs. The river is currently higher than has ever been recorded, far surpassing the 1918 record crest, and continues to rise. How far above flood stage the Yellowston River willrise is hard to determine due to uncertainties with the rain falling on the snow in the high country. As a result the forecast crest should be used as a starting point and not a definite peak. The river will continue to rise as until rainfall subsides and high elevation temperatures drop to around freezing slowing snowmelt. If you live or are recreating near the river move to higher ground, and expect higher water levels than have previously been experienced. The flood waters will continue to move downstream impacting Livingston today. Additional updates to the river forecast and warning will be made as more information becomes available. For the Yellowstone River...including Corwin Springs, Livingston... Unprecented flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Unprecedented flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM MDT Monday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 13.4 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 06/14/1918. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yellowstone River Corwin Spring 11.0 13.5 Mon 9 am 9.7 8.6 8.1 &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued bythis evening at 1030 PM MDT.
